Class CareerCenterStaff

java.lang.Object
entity.User
entity.CareerCenterStaff
public class CareerCenterStaff extends User
Represents a Career Center Staff member who manages internship programs and company relationships.

This entity is responsible for administrative oversight of the internship ecosystem, including approving company representatives, internship postings, and processing withdrawal requests. All operations are pure domain logic without persistence or UI concerns.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Approve/reject company representative registrations
  • Approve/reject internship postings
  • Process withdrawal requests (approve/reject)
  • Generate filtered reports of internships and applications

  • Constructor Details

    • CareerCenterStaff

      public CareerCenterStaff(String userId, String name, String role, String department, String email)
      Constructs a new Career Center Staff member with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier for the staff member
      name - the full name of the staff member
      role - the staff role (e.g., "Officer", "Coordinator")
      department - the department the staff member belongs to
      email - the contact email address for the staff member
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any required field is null or blank

    • approveCompanyRep

      public void approveCompanyRep(CompanyRep rep)
      Approves a company representative account for system access. This method changes the representative's status to approved, allowing them to post internships and manage company information.
      Parameters:
      rep - the company representative to approve
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the representative is null
      See Also:
      • CompanyRep.approve()

    • rejectCompanyRep

      public void rejectCompanyRep(CompanyRep rep, String reason)
      Rejects a company representative account with a specified reason. This method prevents the representative from accessing the system and records the rejection reason for audit purposes.
      Parameters:
      rep - the company representative to reject
      reason - the reason for rejection
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the representative is null
      See Also:
      • CompanyRep.reject(String)

    • approveInternship

      public void approveInternship(Internship internship)
      Approves an internship posting and makes it visible to students. This method both approves the internship and sets it to visible status, allowing students to view and apply for the position.
      Parameters:
      internship - the internship posting to approve
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the internship is null
      See Also:
      • Internship.approve()
      • Internship.setVisible(boolean)

    • rejectInternship

      public void rejectInternship(Internship internship)
      Rejects an internship posting. This method changes the internship status to rejected and typically makes it invisible to students.
      Parameters:
      internship - the internship posting to reject
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the internship is null
      See Also:
      • Internship.reject()

    • approveWithdrawal

      public void approveWithdrawal(WithdrawalRequest req, boolean approve, String note)
      Processes a withdrawal request by either approving or rejecting it. This method handles student requests to withdraw from internships and records staff decision notes for audit purposes.
      Parameters:
      req - the withdrawal request to process
      approve - true to approve the withdrawal, false to reject it
      note - the staff note explaining the decision
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the withdrawal request is null
      See Also:
      • WithdrawalRequest.approve(CareerCenterStaff, String)
      • WithdrawalRequest.reject(CareerCenterStaff, String)

    • filterInternships

      public List<Internship> filterInternships(List<Internship> all, InternshipStatus status, String major, InternshipLevel level, String companyName)
      Filters internships based on multiple criteria for reporting purposes. This method provides a flexible way to generate customized reports by applying optional filters for status, major, level, and company.
      Parameters:
      all - the complete list of internships to filter
      status - the internship status to filter by (optional, null to ignore)
      major - the preferred major to filter by (optional, null to ignore)
      level - the internship level to filter by (optional, null to ignore)
      companyName - the company name to filter by (optional, null to ignore)
      Returns:
      a filtered list of internships matching all specified criteria

      Implementation Note: Returns an empty list if the input list is null
